titleStmt.title: Letter from Donald E. Wilson and Kent Snyder to John G. Neihardt, January 21, 1971
titleStmt.author: Wilson, Donald E., Snyder, Kent

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Letter from Donald E. Wilson to John G. Neihardt, January 21, 1971

msIdentifier.repository: John G. Neihardt Center Research Library, Aly Collection

div1.fw:
SHAWNEE MISSION SOUTH HIGH SCHOOL SHAWNEE MISSION PUBLIC SCHOOLS 5800 WEST 107TH STREET SHAWNEE MISSION, KANSAS 66207 TELEPHONE 913-648-3005
WALLACE R. JOHNSON Principal
WILLIAM D. TIEGREEN Vice-Principal DONALD E. WILSON Vice-Principal JAMES A. MCCOY Administrative Assistant

opener.note: Dr. John G. Neihardt Lincoln, Nebraska

div1.p: On behalf of Shawnee Mission South High School students and faculty, I am very pleased to extend a warm invitation for you to present readings from your poetry works before our student body (approximately 1200) at 1 p.m., February 3, at 5800 West 107th Street, Overland Park.

We are deeply appreciative that Mr. Frank Szasz has been so helpful in arranging this unique opportunity for our high school English and social science students to listen to the reading of a distinguished poet.

It is my understanding that the Kansas City Star Magazine will be photographing your presentation and the informal reception which the Shawnee Mission South Student Congress is planning following the assembly.
I know that the young people will gain from your recitation; we look forward to having you as our guest.

If there are friends in the Kansas City area to whom you wish me to extend a specail invitation to be with us at this time, please let me know. Let us hear from you if we can help in any way in your planning for this assembly.

closer.note: cc cc-Frank Szasz Violet Van Zilen W. Johnson Kent Snyder
